meanings.definition: A trick or deception used to deceive someone.
meanings.sent1: The clever ruse fooled the detective.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his ruse and caught him in the act.
meanings.sent3: The magician's ruse with disappearing coins amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her ruse of pretending to be sick to skip school was quickly discovered.
meanings.sent5: The elaborate ruse to surprise her on her birthday involved many people.

meanings.definition: To deceive someone using a trick or deception.
meanings.sent1: He tried to ruse his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent2: She rused her brother into believing he had won the game.
meanings.sent3: The kids rused their parents by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The con artist rused many people out of their money.
meanings.sent5: She rused her classmates into thinking she had a secret talent.
